item.description:
January 19, 2012
Thursday

 

5:30-8:30pm

 

Genzyme Corporation
500 Kendall Street Cambridge, MA 02142  

$35 - Professionals in biotech/pharma companies and academia

 

$50.00 - Service providers

http://tbnpatentreform.eventbrite.com/

 

On September 16, President Obama signed into law the America Invents Act, the first significant change to patent law since 1952. The two major provisions of the law are the shift from a "first to invent" system to one aligned with patent law in the rest of the world based on "first to file," and provisions for a "post grant review period" designed to address bad patents.

 

Will the new law have as critical an impact, good or bad? Will it fundamentally change deal making in the life sciences? What is the impact on inventors? Attendees will have a chance to hear about these issues and interact with the panel.

 

Agenda


5:30-6:30pm: Refreshments and Networking

6:30-8:00pm: Panel Discussion

8:00-8:30pm: Networking

 

Panel

 

Moderator:

Jennifer Lacroix, Partner, DLA Piper US LLP

 

Panelists:

Todd Foley, Managing Director, MPM Capital

Irena Melnikova, PhD, Director, Prospective and Strategic Initiatives, Sanofi
Christopher K. Mirabelli, Ph.D., Partner, HealthCare Ventures
Lita Nelsen, Director, Technology Licensing Office, Massachusetts Institute of Technology
item.name: Impact of the America Invents Act on deal making in the life sciences industry
